snippet: Kolten Wong, 23, gains perspective from his mother’s death as he looks for a fresh start on the baseball field after ending his 2013 season on a game-ending pickoff in the World Series.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column discusses St Louis Cardinals second baseman Kolten Wong, who is trying for a fresh start after tough year in which his mother died; notes Wong feels motivated by struggles in the previous season, including Game 4 of the World Series, when he became the first player ever to be picked off to end a World Series game.
lead_paragraph: Kolten Wong, 23, gains perspective from his mother’s death as he looks for a fresh start on the baseball field after ending his 2013 season on a game-ending pickoff in the World Series.

headline.main: A Cardinal’s Inspiration to Move Ahead
headline.print_headline: A Cardinal’s Inspiration to Move Ahead
